meanings.definition: To fear or be anxious about something.
meanings.sent1: She dreed the dark forest at night.
meanings.sent2: I dreed the thought of failing the test.
meanings.sent3: He dreed the idea of spiders in his room.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline made her dreed every passing hour.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind made the old house feel dreed.

meanings.definition: To endure or suffer through something.
meanings.sent1: They dreed the long journey through the desert.
meanings.sent2: She dreed the pain of losing her beloved pet.
meanings.sent3: The kids dreed the boring lecture in class.
meanings.sent4: He dreed the harsh winter without proper clothing.
meanings.sent5: The soldier dreed the grueling march ahead.

meanings.definition: To anticipate with dread or apprehension.
meanings.sent1: The students dreed the upcoming final exams.
meanings.sent2: She dreed the meeting with her strict boss.
meanings.sent3: He dreed the dentist appointment all week.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds made them dreed the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the house made her dreed the unknown.
